snippet: Acting more than two weeks after a federal judge struck down Utah’s ban on same-sex marriage, the Supreme Court on Monday halted further unions while an appeals court reviews the ruling.
abstract: Supreme Court blocks further same-sex marriages in Utah while appeals court reviews ruling by Federal Judge Robert J Shelby that struck down state's ban on such unions; move casts doubt over marriages of about 1,000 same-sex couples in state.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and ADAM LIPTAK
byline.contributor: Jack Healy reported from Salt Lake City, and Adam Liptak from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Acting more than two weeks after a federal judge struck down Utah’s ban on same-sex marriage, the Supreme Court on Monday halted further unions while an appeals court reviews the ruling.

headline.main: Justices’ Halt to Gay Marriage Leaves Utah Couples in Limbo
headline.print_headline: Justices’ Halt to Gay Marriage Leaves Utah Couples in Limbo

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
